title: Coronavirus: How the financial shockwave is affecting jobs and money
description: With the UK facing a severe economic downturn, what is the outlook for our personal finances?

title: What sort of future does the conference industry have?
description: Running conferences was a giant business before Covid-19, now the industry is looking for a new direction.

title: Ellie Goulding: 'I'd just become a robot'
description: The star explains why she almost quit music, and how she found her way back after five years off.

title: Alan Rusbridger: Facebook oversight board must avoid 'half-baked judgements'
description: Alan Rusbridger, a member of the oversight board, acknowledged a desire to launch ahead of US vote.

title: Coronavirus: Sheep wool 'barely worth selling any more'
description: Coronavirus has meant a "terrible year" for British wool farmers, with fleeces now almost worthless.

title: Quiz of the week: Which Chicken Run star was 'plucked and stuffed'?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: The Simpsons: The black actor hoping his impressions get him a job
description: Jayden Libran has had loads of support on Simpsons fan sites - but is it enough to get him a job?

title: Coronavirus: 'Dear customers, I face ruin, please come back'
description: Rumit Shah, who runs a chain of greeting cards shops, explains why empty city streets are ruining his business.

title: The bilbies 'thriving' after a 100-year absence in New South Wales
description: The marsupial has bred in the wild in New South Wales for the first time in a century.

title: In pictures: How coronavirus swept through Brazil
description: As the country passes 2m cases, we tell the story of how the outbreak spread in pictures.

title: Aboriginal Australians 'still suffering effects of colonial past'
description: The BBC's Shaimaa Khalil explores how the life chances of indigenous Australians are rooted in colonialism.

title: The Benjamin Netanyahu Twitter hack that never was
description: Politicians and celebrities have had their accounts hijacked but not, apparently, Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Spanish king leads memorial to victims of Covid-19
description: Tributes were paid to the victims of the pandemic outside the Royal Palace in Madrid.

title: Wicksteed Park: Will theme park see its 100th birthday?
description: Wicksteed Park has long been popular with generations of families but it is in financial difficulty.

title: 'Almost certain' Russians sought to interfere in 2019 UK election - Raab
description: The UK government publishes a report on a leaked document used by Labour at the 2019 general election.

title: Shamima Begum can return to UK to fight for citizenship, Court of Appeal rules
description: The 20-year-old, who joined the Islamic State group in Syria, has been denied a fair hearing, judges say.

title: Johnny Depp 'called security to take him away from Amber Heard'
description: The actor's bodyguard claims it was a "recurring cycle that Ms Heard would abuse Mr Depp".

title: England v West Indies: Burns falls leg before wicket as Chase makes breakthrough
description: England opener Rory Burns falls in the last over before lunch despite a review as Roston Chase strikes for the West Indies at Old Trafford.

title: Coronavirus: Manchester Cathedral service remembers victims
description: The Manchester Cathedral service was attended by a maximum of 70 people to aid social distancing.

title: Solar Orbiter: Closest ever pictures taken of the Sun
description: The European Solar Orbiter probe captures images just 77 million km from the Sun's surface.

title: Emergency loans for universities about to go bust
description: Universities at financial risk will have to change subjects and bosses' pay to qualify for rescue package.

title: Who is Shamima Begum and how do you lose your UK citizenship?
description: Ms Begum travelled to Syria to join the so-called Islamic State group in 2015.

title: Charity boss Tony Sewell to head government race commission
description: No 10 confirms Tony Sewell will lead the new body looking into "all aspects" of racial disparity.

title: Jofra Archer excluded from second England-West Indies Test
description: England fast bowler Jofra Archer is excluded from the second Test against West Indies after breaching the bio-secure protocols.

title: Coronavirus: UK payrolls shrink by 649,000 jobs in lockdown
description: Official figures reveal a drop in the number in employment, with young people hard hit.

title: England to play Wales in October friendly at Wembley
description: England will play Wales in a behind-closed-doors friendly at Wembley Stadium on 8 October.

title: Coronavirus: 'No physical distancing' needed for school pupils
description: Physical distancing rules may apply to staff but not pupils when Scotland's schools reopen in August.

title: Coronavirus: Call to infect volunteers in Covid-19 vaccine hunt
description: Prominent scientists call for so-called "challenge trials" to accelerate vaccine development.

title: Iran judiciary may halt protesters' executions after social media storm
description: The hashtag #do_not_execute trended after a court upheld the death sentences of three protesters.

title: Coronavirus: 'My once-in-lifetime holiday hasn't been refunded'
description: A couple tell of their holiday refund "panic" as consumer group Which? calls for action from regulators.

title: Major US Twitter accounts hacked in Bitcoin scam
description: Twitter says a hacking attack on employees was to blame for one of its biggest ever security lapses.

title: Major drive-in tour cancelled over virus fears
description: The tour was set to feature the hit musical Six, and performances by The Streets and Dizzee Rascal.

title: Coronavirus holiday quiz: Do you know the rules about travelling abroad?
description: Take this quiz to test your knowledge of the government's advice on foreign holidays this summer.

title: Olympics Rewind Beijing: Usain Bolt wins 200m gold
description: BBC Sport looks back to the 2008 Beijing Olympics when Usain Bolt completed a brilliant sprint double by smashing the 200m world record.

title: Edward Enninful: British Vogue editor 'racially profiled' at work
description: Edward Enninful says he was racially profiled after being told to "use the loading bay" at his offices.
